results.abstract: The tally is less than 1 percent of all deaths linked to the coronavirus, but it shows that it is possible to die from lingering symptoms after infection.

media.caption: The study was the first nationwide examination of whether long Covid or related terms appeared on death certificates, showing a growing recognition of how serious long-term post-Covid medical problems can be.

results.title: Trump Organization Was Held in Contempt After Secret Trial Last Year
results.abstract: The company was fined $4,000 after failing to turn over documents. The case is one of several in which investigators have found the ex-president or his company loath to hand over papers.

media.caption: It was the second time in less than a year that Donald J. Trump or his company was held in contempt for failing to turn over documents.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.title: Stephen Colbert Doesn’t Want to Editorialize, but He Will
results.abstract: Colbert was shocked by a report that 34 lawmakers texted Mark Meadows about subverting the 2020 election. “That is unbelievable — 34 people wanted to talk to Mark Meadows!” he said.

media.caption: Stephen Colbert said it was “not my place to editorialize,” but that Republican lawmakers who sent text messages about overturning President Biden’s victory were “stupid, evil traitors.”

results.title: A Sign That Tuition Is Too High: Some Colleges Are Slashing It in Half
results.abstract: Colby-Sawyer in New Hampshire has reduced its tuition to $17,500 a year, from about $46,000. But the cut is also a recognition that few pay the list price.

media.caption: Colby-Sawyer has joined a growing number of small, private colleges in what’s called the tuition reset.
media.copyright: Kelly Burgess for The New York Times

results.title: New Suit Uses Data to Back Racial Bias Claims Against State Farm
results.abstract: Black customers have long claimed that the nation’s largest home insurer discriminates against them. A lawsuit claims a nine-month study provides some proof.

media.caption: A home belonging to Jacqueline Huskey, a plaintiff in a lawsuit representing hundreds of State Farm customers who are suing the insurer for discrimination against Black customers.
media.copyright: Evan Jenkins for The New York Times
